private_information: I am agent_1 and I can move disks A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is largest among my disks).
I can perform primitive moves of single disks between pegs but must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk of a peg and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
agent_1.goal: Help achieve the global goal configuration: left peg (top->bottom) A,B,D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg (top->bottom) C; right peg empty, by contributing only moves of disks A,B,C,D,E.

private_information: I am agent_2 and I can move disks F, G, H, I, J (F is smallest and J is largest among my disks).
I can perform primitive moves of single disks between pegs but must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move only the top disk of a peg and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
agent_2.goal: Help achieve the global goal configuration: left peg (top->bottom) A,B,D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg (top->bottom) C; right peg empty, by contributing only moves of disks F,G,H,I,J.

private_information: I am the orchestrator and coordinate agent_1 and agent_2.
I will integrate the agents' move sequences into a verified plan and produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' move sequences into a coherent plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem that capture the two-agent Tower of Hanoi constraints and the target configuration for execution with the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
Initial configuration on left peg from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J where A is smallest and J is largest.
Middle and right pegs are initially empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top->bottom A, B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg top->bottom C; right peg empty.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, only the top disk of any peg may be moved, and a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may only move disks A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 may only move disks F,G,H,I,J.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Using the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and you may only move disks A,B,C,D,E. Use the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Provide the full ordered sequence covering only your moves that contribute to the global goal.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the required format and only for disks A,B,C,D,E.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Using the public information and your private information, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules and you may only move disks F,G,H,I,J. Use the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left, middle, or right. Provide the full ordered sequence covering only your moves that contribute to the global goal.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Private info: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the required format and only for disks F,G,H,I,J.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL and planning for the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the two agents' move sequences into a single coherent plan and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must model two agents with distinct actions for their allowed disks and must enforce Tower of Hanoi constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Keep agent actions distinct, naming them clearly to indicate which agent performs them.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Agent_1 info: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Agent_2 info: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Agent_1 proposed moves: {moves_agent_1}. Agent_2 proposed moves: {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any conflicts, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that capture the initial configuration, the goal configuration, the two-agent action distinctions, and the Tower of Hanoi constraints for solving with FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
